highlights: Pioneers the use of mature Danionella, tiny, translucent fish, to study the neuronal basis of navigation
Collaboratively designs, tests and optimizes a multi-component behavioral rig, including a fish tank, maze arena, IR lighting, synchronous cameras, automated feeding, and sound stimuli and recording
Establishes replicability by using MATLAB and python for machine learning based animal tracking
Builds team knowledge by regularly presenting data and scientific literature at lab meetings
work.company: Howard Hughes Medical Institute, Janelia Research Campus

highlights: Published novel findings on memory formation and persistence in neural circuits
Conducted courtship conditioning, sleep, and neural luminescence assays with precision and speed
Expertly applied Drosophila genetics for flawless execution of crosses and stock maintenance
Ensured successful publication via contributions to scientific discussions and manuscript revision
Employed multiple software applications to accurately record, rigorously analyze and visualize data
work.company: Howard Hughes Medical Institute, Janelia Research Campus

highlights: Expertly dissected and mounted adult Drosophila central nervous systems
Reliably provided precise immunohistochemistry and confocal microscopy data to collaborators
work.company: Howard Hughes Medical Institute, Janelia Research Campus
work.position: Research Technician I, Project Technical Resources

publications.description: Meissner, G et al. [including Henderson, K]. A split-GAL4 driver line for Drosophila CNS cell types. bioRxiv (2024).
Lei, Z., Henderson, K. & Keleman, K. A neural circuit linking learning and sleep in Drosophila long-term memory. Nat Commun 13, 609 (2022).

volunteer.title: Certified Virginia Master Naturalist, Banshee Reeks Chapter, Leesburg, VA
volunteer.summary: Secretary, Board of Directors, 2018 – 2021; 450+ administrative, outreach, stewardship and citizen science volunteer hours
